summary: Completed frontend testing for three pediatric medical calculator updates: 1) Hyponatremia Mild/Asymptomatic Infant/Child toggle, 2) IEM Emergencies SMC Guideline/UpToDate toggle, 3) Acetaminophen Rumack-Matthew Nomogram with calibrated coordinates. All 8 test cases PASSED.
passed_tests: TEST 1: Hyponatremia Mild/Asymptomatic - Infant/Child toggle buttons appear instead of entry box - PASSED
TEST 2: Hyponatremia Mild/Asymptomatic - Click Infant button shows 5%/10%/15% options with calculated ml values (500ml/1000ml/1500ml for 10kg) - PASSED
TEST 3: Hyponatremia Mild/Asymptomatic - Child button shows 3%/6%/9% options with calculated ml values - PASSED
TEST 4: IEM Emergencies - SMC Guideline / UpToDate toggle appears with data-testid='iem-guideline-switch' - PASSED
TEST 5: IEM Emergencies - Default view (SMC Guideline) shows Disease Crisis Quick Reference table with 9 diseases - PASSED
TEST 6: IEM Emergencies - Toggle to UpToDate shows Clinical Presentations and Lab Evaluation tables - PASSED
TEST 7: Acetaminophen Nomogram - SVG loads correctly from /images/rumack_matthew_nomogram_new.svg (500x605 dimensions) - PASSED
TEST 8: Acetaminophen Nomogram - Point plotting at 4 hours 150 mcg/mL works - point appears on chart with 'ABOVE TREATMENT LINE - START NAC' warning - PASSED
critical_code_review_comments: ElectrolytesDialog.jsx: Hyponatremia Mild/Asymptomatic correctly implements Infant/Child selector with hypoDeficitType and hypoDeficitPercent states
ElectrolytesDialog.jsx: Infant shows 5%/10%/15% (50ml/100ml/150ml per kg), Child shows 3%/6%/9% (30ml/60ml/90ml per kg)
IEMEmergencyApproach.jsx: Toggle switch correctly implemented with useState for useUpToDate state and data-testid='iem-guideline-switch'
IEMEmergencyApproach.jsx: SMC Guideline shows Disease Crisis Quick Reference table with 9 diseases (Propionic Acidemia, MMA, MSUD, VLCAD, CPT1, GSD1, Mitochondrial, PKU, Hunter)
IEMEmergencyApproach.jsx: UpToDate view shows Key Points, Clinical Presentations (Neurologic 85%, GI 58%), Initial Laboratory Evaluation, Distinguishing IEM by Lab Findings tables
AcetaminophenApproach.jsx: Nomogram SVG correctly loaded from /images/rumack_matthew_nomogram_new.svg with viewBox 0 0 620 750.40002
AcetaminophenApproach.jsx: Coordinate calibration correct - chartLeft=116, chartRight=500, chartTop=82, chartBottom=657 for hours 4-24 and concentration 5-1000 mcg/mL
AcetaminophenApproach.jsx: Point plotting overlay uses SVG circles with pulsing animation for visibility
context_for_next_testing_agent: Three features verified: 1) Hyponatremia Mild/Asymptomatic - Infant/Child toggle replaces fluid deficit entry box, Infant shows 5%/10%/15%, Child shows 3%/6%/9% with calculated ml values. Access via: Children > Electrolytes tab (3rd button in floating tab bar) > Select Sodium > Hyponatremia > Mild/Asymptomatic. 2) IEM Emergencies - SMC Guideline/UpToDate toggle with data-testid='iem-guideline-switch'. Access via: Children > Approaches > IEM Emergencies dropdown. 3) Acetaminophen Nomogram - New optimized SVG with calibrated coordinates, point plotting works at 4h/150mcg/mL. Access via: Children > Approaches > Acetaminophen Overdose dropdown.
